page.title: 08 MAGOG FARM
page.content: Magog farm surrounds Wandlebury Nature Reserve. The farmer has 412 acres including 5 acres of woodland. He has worked it for 40 years, enjoys farming. Membership of COMMON MARKET{ has meant higher prices, increased mechanization and fewer workers. 2 men and 1 part-time worker are employed. Mainly arable, half the crops are sold by a co-operative, half through merchants. Crossbred heifers (continental mothers and English bulls) are fattened for sale to local Shelford butcher. The farm house was built about 1830. The site was used for RACING STABLES until sold as a 'model farm' in 1896. Some 100 yr old hedges surround the farms and divide the fields. Deciduous trees are to be seen and a few conifers.
